content.description: Sit start and jam the beautiful finger crack. This is harder than it looks!
content.location: It is on the back side of the Anvil Boulder.

content.description: Stand start on the slabby, extremely textured face with your right hand on a good high crimp by the arete. Establish on the face, and climb the texture to the top.
content.location: It is left of The Blacksmith.

content.description:
Sit start with hands in the crack on the right near the tree using the sidepull jug. You could match on the jug or use one hand on the higher crimpy sidepull, whatever feels better to start.

Throw left, around the corner, and work up the rail. Use hands only in the rail and feet wherever works for you. Once you reach the lip at the end of the rail, top out.

 It is a short problem but is a little trickier than you might expect.

 This has probably been climbed before (but required a bit of cleaning today and there were no chalk marks), so if you know the FA, please update.
content.protection: A crashpad helps, but you don’t really need it, since it’s so low.
content.location: It is on the opposite side of Where's Henry?  on the corner close to the trail.

content.description: Sit start matched in the hole or one hand in hole and the other on the crimp next to it. Work up towards the next hole using crimps, the arete, whatever you can find. There's a decent hold on top for the left hand on the topout. Bring a rag to help clean and dry the two holes. Then douse them with chalk, and you should be golden. There is nice movement on this one.
content.location: It is to the right of the two trees to the right of Where's Henry?  This on the far right of the North side of the boulder.

content.description: Sit start with two jugs, make a move up to the little pocket, and top out.
content.location: It is to the left of The Hammer.

content.description: Squat/stand start on two decent edges to the left of the tree. Work pretty much straight up on good holds to the peak of the boulder. A much harder sit start may be possible.
content.location: It is on the southeast face of the boulder to the left of the tree that is left of Henry and the Angry Inch. It is on the side of the boulder facing the red trail.

content.description: This is a decent-sized boulder near the intersection of Blue and Red Trails. Currently there are five problems from V0- to V3. These are some of the better problems at Garfield Woods.
